meanings.definition: An area of land covered with dense vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The explorer got lost in the bushlot while searching for rare plants.
meanings.sent2: The bushlot behind the house was a home to many birds and insects.
meanings.sent3: The bushlot seemed like a secret garden hidden from the world.
meanings.sent4: The bushlot was a green maze, full of mystery and life.
meanings.sent5: The bushlot was so thick with trees that sunlight barely reached the ground.

meanings.definition: To clear or cultivate a bushlot.
meanings.sent1: The farmer decided to bushlot the overgrown field to plant crops.
meanings.sent2: It took days of hard work to bushlot the wild area into a productive farm.
meanings.sent3: He planned to bushlot the backyard and turn it into a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent4: She bushlotted the land with care, creating space for new growth.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to bushlot the park for a summer fair.

meanings.definition: A person who lives in a bushlot.
meanings.sent1: The bushlot dweller enjoyed the peaceful solitude of nature.
meanings.sent2: Living as a bushlot meant being surrounded by the beauty of the wild.
meanings.sent3: The bushlot resident was known for their love of the outdoors.
meanings.sent4: She was a true bushlot, finding joy in the simplicity of the land.
meanings.sent5: The old man was a wise bushlot, sharing stories of the forest with visitors.
